Comments_List: It was a good introduction to Modern Jewish history, like it says on the title

-historiography of modern European Jewry
-critical approaches to history

The course was strong, with good readings and strong connections between the different topics. I might shift up the time frame slightly, as the course ran out of time a little bit near the end. Still, cutting out anything is difficult.

The course is expansive and helpful. Perhaps there could have been some primary sources, but that may have made it too unwieldy. Occasionally Dr. Sorkin assigns a slightly unreasonable amount of reading (400-500 pages), but usually it is manageable, and he uses class time productively to enhance understanding of material that may have been skimmed (as well, obviously, as material that has already been read thoroughly).
Yes, the course gives a great introduction to Jewish history in the modern period.

Yes, Prof. Sorkin does what he says - provides a good introduction to European Jewish history. A good place to start for getting a background on the subject, though it might do to have students with a background in European history in general.
Yes. Anyone with an interest in modern European Jewish history should take this course.
